title: Wrappers to Simplify Pretty ggplot2 Visualisation
text: {ggblanket} package wrapper functions around amazing {ggplot2} package. aims simplify pretty {ggplot2} visualisation. , {ggblanket} package: uses gg_* functions wrap ggplot2::ggplot call single ggplot2::geom_* function merges col fill aesthetics single col aesthetic provides colour customisation via pal alpha arguments treats faceting aesthetic provides good-looking default x y scales provides prefixed arguments customisable scale adjustment arranges horizontal geom y col labels etc correct order converts unspecified titles snakecase::to_sentence default provides access relevant geom arg’s dots argument supports ggplotly use. provides gg_blank function even flexibility. like show support {ggblanket}, can buy coffee give repository star.

title: Wrappers to Simplify Pretty ggplot2 Visualisation
text: Install either CRAN : install development version :
code: install.packages("ggblanket") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("davidhodge931/ggblanket")

title: Wrappers to Simplify Pretty ggplot2 Visualisation
text: Click {ggblanket} website.

title: Wrappers to Simplify Pretty ggplot2 Visualisation
text: {ggblanket} uses gg_* functions wrap ggplot2::ggplot call single ggplot2::geom_* function.  {ggblanket} merges col fill aesthetics single col aesthetic.  {ggblanket} provides colour customisation via pal alpha arguments.  {ggblanket} treats faceting aesthetic.  {ggblanket} provides good-looking default x y scales. : x categorical y numeric/date: y_limits default min/max y_breaks y_expand c(0, 0) y categorical x numeric/date: x_limits default min/max x_breaks x_expand c(0, 0) x numeric/date y numeric/date: y_limits default min/max y_breaks y_expand c(0, 0), x_limits default NULL (.e. min/max x variable) x_expand c(0.025, 0.025)  {ggblanket} provides prefixed arguments customisable scale adjustment. designed work Rstudio autocomplete help find adjustment need. Press tab key typing x_,y_, col_ facet_ access . use arrow keys, press tab select. Available arguments x, y, col facet: *_breaks``*_limits, *_include, *_expand, *_labels. x y, also *_trans argument. col facet, also *_intervals argument.  {ggblanket} arranges horizontal geom y col labels etc correct order.  {ggblanket} converts unspecified titles snakecase::to_sentence default.  {ggblanket} provides access relevant geom arg’s dots argument.  {ggblanket} supports ggplotly use. ggplotly won’t work situations, functions arguments. work lot time.  {ggblanket} provides gg_blank function even flexibility.
code: library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) library(ggblanket) library(palmerpenguins) iris %>%   gg_point(x = Sepal.Width, y = Sepal.Length, col = Species) penguins %>%    gg_histogram(x = body_mass_g, col = species) penguins %>%    gg_density(x = body_mass_g, col = species,               pal = pals::brewer.dark2(3),               alpha = 0.5) penguins %>%    tidyr::drop_na() %>%   mutate(sex = stringr::str_to_sentence(sex)) %>%    gg_violin(x = sex, y = body_mass_g, facet = species) storms %>%   group_by(year) %>%   filter(between(year, 1980, 2020)) %>%   summarise(wind = mean(wind, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%   gg_col(     x = year,     y = wind,     x_labels = ~.x,     title = "Storm wind speed",     subtitle = "USA average storm wind speed, 1980\u20132020",     y_title = "Wind speed (knots)",     caption = "Source: NOAA"   ) penguins %>%   gg_jitter(     x = species,     y = body_mass_g,     col = flipper_length_mm,     position = ggplot2::position_jitter(width = 0.2, height = 0, seed = 123),      col_intervals = ~ santoku::chop_quantiles(.x, probs = seq(0, 1, 0.25)),     col_legend_place = "b",     y_include = 0,     y_breaks = scales::breaks_width(1500),      y_labels = scales::label_number()   ) penguins %>%   tidyr::drop_na() %>%    group_by(species, sex, island) %>%   summarise(body_mass_kg = mean(body_mass_g) / 1000) %>%   gg_col(x = body_mass_kg, y = species, col = sex, facet = island,          col_labels = stringr::str_to_sentence,           position = "dodge",           col_legend_place = "b") penguins %>%   group_by(species, sex) %>%   summarise(across(body_mass_g, ~ round(mean(.x, na.rm = TRUE)), 0)) %>%    gg_tile(sex, species, col = body_mass_g,            x_labels = snakecase::to_sentence_case,           pal = pals::brewer.blues(9),           width = 0.9,            height = 0.9,            title = "Average penguin body mass",           subtitle = "Palmer Archipelago, Antarctica",           theme = gg_theme(pal_axis = "#ffffff", pal_ticks = "#ffffff")) +   geom_text(aes(label = body_mass_g), col = "#232323", size = 3.5) penguins %>%   tidyr::drop_na() %>%    gg_smooth(     x = bill_length_mm,     y = flipper_length_mm,     col = species,     level = 0.99,     size = 0.5     ) iris %>%    mutate(Species = stringr::str_to_sentence(Species)) %>%    add_tooltip_text(titles = snakecase::to_sentence_case) %>%    gg_point(x = Sepal.Width,             y = Sepal.Length,             col = Species,             text = text,             theme = gg_theme("helvetica", y_grid = TRUE)) %>%    plotly::ggplotly(tooltip = "text") penguins %>%   tidyr::drop_na() %>%   mutate(sex = stringr::str_to_sentence(sex)) %>%    gg_blank(x = flipper_length_mm, col = sex, facet = species,             col_legend_place = "b", y_title = "Density") +   geom_histogram(aes(y = after_stat(density)), alpha = 0.9) penguins %>%   tidyr::drop_na() %>%   mutate(sex = stringr::str_to_sentence(sex)) %>%   group_by(species, sex) %>%   summarise(     mean = round(mean(bill_length_mm, na.rm = TRUE), 0),     n = n(),     se = mean / sqrt(n),     upper = mean + 1.96 * se,     lower = mean - 1.96 * se   ) %>%   gg_blank(     x = sex,     y = mean,     col = sex,     facet = species,     label = mean,     ymin = lower,     ymax = upper,     yend = upper + 10,     y_include = 0,     y_title = "Bill length mm"   ) +   geom_col(width = 0.75, alpha = 0.9) +   geom_errorbar(width = 0.1, colour = pal_na()) +   geom_text(aes(y = upper + 5), fill = NA, size = 3)

title: Add a tooltip text column of united variable names and values. — add_tooltip_text
text: data data frame tibble. ... Arguments passed select (.e unquoted variables, tidyselect helpers etc). arguments provided, uses columns. titles function format variable names, including rlang lambda format.

title: Add a tooltip text column of united variable names and values. — add_tooltip_text
text: data frame tibble column text

title: Add a tooltip text column of united variable names and values. — add_tooltip_text
code:
iris %>% add_tooltip_text() %>% head(1) #> Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species #> 1 5.1 3.5 1.4 0.2 setosa #> text #> 1 Sepal.Length: 5.1
Sepal.Width: 3.5
Petal.Length: 1.4
Petal.Width: 0.2
Species: setosa iris %>% add_tooltip_text(Species, tidyselect::contains("Sepal")) %>% head(1) #> Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species #> 1 5.1 3.5 1.4 0.2 setosa #> text #> 1 Species: setosa
Sepal.Length: 5.1
Sepal.Width: 3.5 library(snakecase) iris %>% add_tooltip_text(titles = ~ to_sentence_case(.x)) %>% head(1) #> Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species #> 1 5.1 3.5 1.4 0.2 setosa #> text #> 1 Sepal length: 5.1
Sepal width: 3.5
Petal length: 1.4
Petal width: 0.2
Species: setosa iris %>% add_tooltip_text() %>% gg_point(x = Sepal.Width, y = Sepal.Length, col = Species, text = text, theme = gg_theme("helvetica", x_grid = TRUE, y_grid = TRUE)) %>% plotly::ggplotly(tooltip = "text") #> ℹ {ggblanket} converts unspecified titles using snakecase::to_sentence_case. text: font font text use. Defaults "". font_title font title. NULL, inherits font argument. font_subtitle font subtitle. NULL, inherits font argument. font_body font text title, subtitle caption. NULL, inherits font argument. font_caption font caption. NULL, inherits font argument. size_title size title font. Defaults 11. size_subtitle size subtitle font. Defaults 10. size_body size text title, subtitle caption. Defaults 10. size_caption size caption. Defaults 9. size_axis size axis. Defaults 0.3. size_ticks size ticks. Defaults 0.3. size_grid size vertical major gridlines. Defaults 0.2. style_title style title font. Defaults "bold". style_subtitle style subtitle font. Defaults "plain". style_body style text title, subtitle caption. Defaults "plain". style_caption style caption. Defaults "plain". pal_title colour palette title font. Defaults "#000000". pal_subtitle colour palette subtitle font. Defaults "#323232". pal_body colour palette text title, subtitle caption. Defaults "#323232". pal_caption colour palette caption. Defaults "#7F7F7F". pal_axis colour palette axis. Defaults "#323232". pal_ticks colour palette ticks. Defaults "#323232". pal_background two colour vector. first colour panel (legend key). second colour rest background. pal_grid colour palette vertical major gridlines. Defaults "#D3D3D3". x_grid TRUE FALSE whether show vertical gridlines. y_grid TRUE FALSE whether show hotizontal gridlines. void TRUE FALSE whether drop axis lines, ticks x y labels. Useful maps. Defaults FALSE.

title: ggblanket 1.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-07-01 Added support *_breaks receive function. Added *_include argument. Added *_trans argument. Modified default x_breaks behaviour x y numeric date. Breaking: Removed *_breaks_n *_breaks_width. Enhanced gg_blank work one x y. Provided support ggplotly. Added new add_tooltip_text function. Added new titles argument apply function across titles. Support gg_ functions working stats. Removed size argument, anticipation ggplot2 3.4.0. Updated gg_theme title vjust margins.
